text1: A common modification on remote worlds that cannot rely on nearby patrol for defence. This improved kite was refitted with cheap metal plating to increase its survivability in long and unprotected journeys.
The boulder was a first attempt to a new age of domain era midline destroyer. Although cheap, it received subsequent criticism for its lack of firepower.

An old, but reliable design, the Endeavour-class cruisers once sailed as the backbone of most navy. 
Called the flying “brick” by its crew, its sleek profile was its best advantage. The ballistic fire it usually encountered often lacked accuracy, permitting for the ship to avoid most incoming firepower while delivering the killing blow. 
With the rise of energy and enhanced weaponry, the ship was left out for better designs as it lacks the necessary armor to absorb these more accurate weapons.

After the decommission of the military Endeavour-class, the old, armored cruiser flooded the market. A few traders, seeing some potential in the hull, spend many cycles redesigning and upgrading the ship to suit their needs. Adding some cargo, some fuel tanks, a hangar bay... the ship became a favorite in the Persean sector.
